block.p: Two representatives from Spalding were at the Nets' practice facility yesterday as players tested the company's synthetic basketballs.

The N.B.A. started this season with a new synthetic ball that players complained was too slippery and gave them cuts on their hands. The league switched back to the traditional leather ball in January.
Two representatives from Spalding were at the Nets' practice facility yesterday as players tested the company's synthetic basketballs.

The N.B.A. started this season with a new synthetic ball that players complained was too slippery and gave them cuts on their hands. The league switched back to the traditional leather ball in January.
Nets point guard Jason Kidd, one of the biggest critics of the synthetic ball used earlier in the season, seemed pleased that the league was looking for input.
Still, Kidd was not necessarily a fan of change. ''Anytime you get equipment change and you've been in the league for a while, you hope they wait until after you're done,'' he said.
Sixteen teams have tested the new balls, but the N.B.A. is expected to stick with the leather ball next season.
